metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4463 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Compute (Nova) Folsom, Grizzly, and Havana does not properlyverify the virtual size of a QCOW2 image, which allows local users to causea denial of service (host file system disk consumption) via a compressedQCOW2 image. NOTE: this issue is due to an incomplete fix forCVE-2013-2096.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4463` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-api - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-api-ec2 - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-api-metadata - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-api-os-compute - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-api-os-volume - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-baremetal - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-cells - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-cert - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-common - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-compute - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-kvm - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-lxc - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-qemu - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-uml - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-compute-xen - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-conductor - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-console - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-consoleauth - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-network - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-novncproxy - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-objectstore - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-scheduler - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-spiceproxy - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-volume - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
nova-xvpvncproxy - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
python-nova - 1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1~b1-0ubuntu2').
